Text: for the 5000th time, mkv is a container, not a codec. the codec (which gives such a great compression ratio) is h264, which is a standard in about everything (including your HDTV cable/satellite)

I agree with both of you.  

It's just a container.  Some of the devices like the D-Link 520, don't recognize it.  That sucks.

Luckily, the WD TV Live does recognize it.  

There are converters that I'm guessing basically rename the file, or do some other relatively simple conversion to allow devices that don't recognize mkv files to play them as vob or avi files.

I love h.264/mkv.
No more transcoding... just rewrapping to mp4, takes 10 minutes.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_yJkg3kgSr0&feature

FUCK XVID/AVI!!! When will this crappy outdated, outmoded, inferior codec and wrapper finally die the death it deserves???
For anyone watching on a PC and having a problem with MKV files, simply download the K-Lite codec pack and/or VLC player.

FYI, this got me "
This message is to advise that Cox Communications has received a notice claiming that you are using your Cox High Speed Internet service to post or transmit material in violation of U.S. Copyright law.  We have included a copy of the complaint, which identifies the party raising it and the material claimed to be infringing." From my ISP. Be wary of this one....
